articles.author: MARIA SHERMAN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Twenty years on from the release of his debut album, the career making “Get Lifted,” John Legend is entering uncharted territory. On Aug.
articles.title: Q&A: John Legend on his ambitious children's album, 'My Favorite Dream,' and new single, 'L-O-V-E'

articles.author: MAKIYA SEMINERA, JOHN MINCHILLO and ALLEN G. BREED
articles.description: LUCAMA, N.C. (AP) — The remnants of Debby picked up the pace Friday, moving north and northeast from the Carolinas and still packing a punch with heavy rains, flash flooding and the threat of tornadoes.
articles.title: Debby bringing heavy rain, flooding and possible tornadoes northeast into the weekend

articles.author: ALI SWENSON
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Iran is accelerating online activity that appears intended to influence the U.S. election, in one case targeting a presidential campaign with an email phishing attack, Microsoft said Friday.
articles.title: Iran is accelerating cyber activity that appears meant to influence the US election, Microsoft says

articles.author: GABRIEL SANDOVAL and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris and her new running mate will hold a rally in Arizona on Friday as part of their tour of electoral battlegrounds, visiting a state where Harris passed over a prominent Democrat in favor of Minnesota Gov.
articles.title: Harris and Walz head to Arizona, where a VP runner-up could still make a difference

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia declared a “federal-level” emergency in the Kursk region following a large-scale incursion from Ukraine and sent reinforcements there on Friday, four days after hundreds of Ukrainian troops poured across the border in what appeared to be Kyiv’s biggest attack on Russian soil since the war began.
articles.title: Russia declares an emergency in Kursk, under attack by Ukraine. 11 killed in Russian strike on mall

articles.author: JIM SALTER
articles.description: FERGUSON, Mo. (AP) — Michael Brown once told his father the “world is going to know my name,” words Michael Brown Sr. still takes to heart.Friday marks 10 years since the 18-year-old was killed by a police officer in Ferguson, Missouri, turning the St.
articles.title: Ferguson marks 10 years since Michael Brown's death. While there's some progress, challenges persist

articles.author: GREG BEACHAM
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Algerian boxer Imane Khelif is one victory away from wrapping up her tumultuous Paris Olympics with a gold medal around her neck — a potential prize that she has called the best response to a cascade of online abuse she has endured over misconceptions about her sex.
articles.title: Boxer Imane Khelif fights for gold to cap an Olympics filled with misinformed scrutiny

articles.author: JILL COLVIN, MICHELLE L. PRICE and ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — Donald Trump recommitted to debating Vice President Kamala Harris after recently backing out, holding a lengthy news conference Thursday in which he taunted his new rival, boasted of his crowd on Jan.
articles.title: Trump recommits to a Sept. 10 debate and lashes out at Harris at news conference

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli troops launched a new assault Friday into the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis, targeting Hamas fighters who the military claims still operate there despite repeated offensives, as American, Qatari and Egyptian mediators renewed their push for Israel and Hamas to reach a cease-fire deal.
articles.title: Israeli troops launch a new assault into Gaza's Khan Younis as mediators push for cease-fire talks

articles.author: MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: DEDHAM, Mass. (AP) — Defense attorneys for Karen Read are expected to argue Friday that two charges in the death of her Boston police officer boyfriend be dismissed, focusing on the jury deliberations that led to a mistrial.
articles.title: Hearing in Karen Read case expected to focus on jury deliberations
